intro: Kochia eriophora, commonly known as the sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and fuzzy, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, branching inflorescences. Kochia eriophora is adapted to harsh, dry environments and is often found in sandy or disturbed soils. It is an important plant in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for various insects.
